alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 6:19PM EDT until June 13 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, Butler, Clermont and Hamilton. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 619 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cincinnati, Fairfield, Norwood, Forest Park, Sharonville, Blue Ash, Loveland, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, Harrison, North College Hill, Madeira, Wyoming, Cheviot, Milford, Mount Healthy, Deer Park, Greendale and Finneytown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
